PREFACE.

No speech of Gicero's is better fitted to be the first studied by the young student than that commonly known as the Oration pro Leye Mani- lia, with the possible exception of the speech pro Archia. But while the latter has recently been admirably edited by Mr J. S. Reid (Pity Pro-ss Series, 1878), the editor of this volume is not aware of any useful and trustworthy English school edition of the former. It appeared there- fore worth while, with the kind sanction of Prof. Halm of Munichâ€š to issue an adaptation of his well-known smaller edition for the use of English students.
